name: trivago exposure algorithms
description: As a Java developer at trivago, my team was responsible for determining the placement of hotels and advertiser deals for all searches. Our service ran billions of auctions daily, carefully balancing the interests of users, advertisers and our company, and accounting for the majority of trivago's revenue.

name: Japanese Tokenizer
description: Most existing Japanese tokenizers output short unit words, extremely-granular morphemic units that are difficult to find in a dictionary or interpret as a learner of Japanese. For my clients' product, I wrote a tokenizer that outputs phonological words such as conjugated verbs and affixed nouns. The result is simpler for learners to digest and understand, improving the product experience.

name: Car navigation assistant
description: I built an NLU agent used in Japanese cars sold in the US. The agent would respond to spoken commands such as, "take me to John's house" and "where can I buy a Coke?".

name: Japanese â‡„ Turkish machine translation system
description: I built a custom translation system used in a Japanese rubber factory located in Turkey. Our system handled the complex morphology of Turkish better than other state-of-the-art translation systems.

name: ITS Work in Context System
description: The Internationalization Tag Set is a standard for embedding document metadata containing translation instructions. Examples include links to specialized terminology, maximum phrase length, or restrictions to specified locales. For the EU-funded WICS project, I implemented the entire ITS standard as a tool for viewing translation instructions in the browser.
